_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental realease prevention and emergency response policies at the United Cooperative Association  at Monona Iowa.
This facility complies with NFAP-58 requirements for LP-Gas storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency to occurs it is our policy to  notify the Monona Fire Department and request they respond to the emergency.
A description of the facility and the regulated substance handled.
The Monona Propane plant is a storage tank providing back-up  fuel for the Grain Dryers during natural gas cold weather curtailment. 
The worst-case release scenario.
Our worst case scenario is failure of the storage tank when filled to the amount allowed, resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. According to EPA's look-up tables, the distance to end-point is .4 miles. There would be private homes within the distance to end-point, with a total population of 14 people.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention program steps. 
This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.
Five year accident history. 
We have never had an accident involving propane that caused death, injuries, property  or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place. 
The emergency reponse program.
In event of the an emergency involving our propane storage, it is our policy to notify the Monona Fire Department and the Clayton County LEPC and request they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the fire department and  members of the fire department have inspected our propane system.
Planned changes to improve safety. None.
